DataElement.preferredDefinition: The unit for the duration of treatment interruption.

ValueDomain.preferredName: CDISC CDASH Unit for Duration of Treatment Interruption Terminology Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A terminology subset of the CDISC Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM) Unit codelist created for Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization (CDASH) Unit for Duration of Treatment Interruption terminology._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.

Concepts.definition: A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The second is the unit of time, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). The second is the duration of 919 263 177 0 periods of the specified light radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the ground state of the caesium 133 atom in its ground state at 0 K. According to the convention, 60 seconds constitute one minute; 3,600 seconds constitute one hour. Abbreviation Sec. is acceptable in non-scientific usage only.

Concepts.definition: A unit of time, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). The second is the duration of 919 263 177 0 periods of the specified light radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the caesium 133 atom in its ground state at 0 K. According to the convention, 60 seconds constitute one minute; 3,600 seconds constitute one hour.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.

Concepts.definition: A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.

ReferenceDocuments.name: If the dose was interrupted,
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the dose was interrupted, what were the units for the interruption duration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC CDASH Unit for Duration of Treatment Interruption Terminology
ReferenceDocuments.description: A terminology subset of the CDISC Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM) Unit codelist created for Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization (CDASH) Unit for Duration of Treatment Interruption terminology.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form  Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: Record the unit (e.g., MINUTES, HOURS, DAYS) for the duration of treatment interruption.

ReferenceDocuments.name: SUPPEX.QVAL
ReferenceDocuments.description: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPEX dataset as the value of SUPPEX.QVAL where SUPPEX.QNAM = "EXITRP" and SUPPEX.QLABEL="Collected Interruption Duration". Concatenate the collected treatment interruption duration and the duration unit components and create EXINTRP using ISO 8601 Period format. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: The unit should be collected and converted into ISO 8601 period format.
